name: Water Manipulation
author: CrusaderDroid
desc:
You freely manipulate water as you please in the area around you, allowing you to move water in and out of the area as well as change the direction of its flow.

In addition, once per turn, now and for 2 AP on subsequent turns, you can choose one of the following attack methods:

>Rushing water slams into a target creature within range, who must make a Strength saving throw or take 6d6 bludgeoning damage, be knocked back 10 feet in any horizontal direction you choose, and fall prone. On a success, they take half damage, move 5 feet, and are not knocked prone.
>A 5 foot cube of water is transformed into an aquatic prison for a target creature within range that you can see, who must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be trapped in the bubble. They are restrained until they spend 3 AP to make a Strength saving throw to break free. The requisite size of water needed increases by 5 feet for each size category above Medium.
>While totally submerged, you use the surrounding water to blast away from you, attempting to damage all creatures you choose in range. Each creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 4d10 bludgeoning damage, halved on a success.
